organizations.name: UN
quotes: The Panel’s Recommendation 3A urges the UN Secretary-General to begin a process that invites views from all stakeholders on how human rights can be meaningfully applied to ensure that no gaps in protection are caused by new and emerging digital technologies.

organizations.name: India’s Supreme Court
quotes: India’s Supreme Court has issued a judgement defining what the right to privacy means in the digital context.

organizations.name: Nigeria
quotes: Nigeria’s draft Digital Rights and Freedom Bill tries to apply international human rights law to national digital realities.

organizations.name: The Global Compact
quotes: The Global Compact and UNICEF have developed guidance on how businesses should approach children’s rights in the digital age.

organizations.name: UNICEF
quotes: The Global Compact and UNICEF have developed guidance on how businesses should approach children’s rights in the digital age.

organizations.name: UNESCO
quotes: UNESCO has used its Rights, Openness, Access and Multi-stakeholder governance (ROAM) framework to discuss AI’s implications for rights including freedom of expression, privacy, equality and participation in public life.

organizations.name: Council of Europe
quotes: The Council of Europe has developed recommendations and guidelines, and the European Court of Human Rights has produced case law, interpreting the European Convention on Human Rights in the digital realm.

organizations.name: European Court of Human Rights
quotes: The Council of Europe has developed recommendations and guidelines, and the European Court of Human Rights has produced case law, interpreting the European Convention on Human Rights in the digital realm.

roles.title: UN Secretary-General
quotes: The Panel’s Recommendation 3A urges the UN Secretary-General to begin a process that invites views from all stakeholders on how human rights can be meaningfully applied to ensure that no gaps in protection are caused by new and emerging digital technologies.

supporting_quotes: The Panel’s Recommendation 3A urges the UN Secretary-General to begin a process that invites views from all stakeholders on how human rights can be meaningfully applied to ensure that no gaps in protection are caused by new and emerging digital technologies.
assembled_events.notes: The role of UN Secretary-General is clearly associated with the UN, indicating an active position.

issues.description: The supporting quote does not clearly indicate that the UN Secretary-General holds the position, but rather mentions a recommendation directed at the role.
Missing time markers, which could be important for establishing the duration of the career position.
